docblock.description: This file is part of the Aura Project for PHP.
An abstract class to map entity fields to table columns.
The SQL table this mapper works with.
A map of table columns to entity fields.
The primary column in the table (maps to the identity field.)
The identity field in the entity (maps to the primary column).
Returns the list of table columns.
Returns the table column name for a given entity field name.
Returns the list of entity fields.
Returns the entity field name for a given table column name.
Returns the identity field name for mapped entities.
Given an entity object, returns the identity field value.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The value of the identity field on the object.

docblock.description: Returns the primary column name on the table.
Returns the mapped SQL table name.
Returns a column name, dot-prefixed with the table name.
Returns a column name, dot-prefixed with the table name, "AS" its mapped entity name.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The fully-qualified table-and-column name "AS" the mapped entity name.

docblock.description: Returns the primary column name, dot-prefixed with the table name.
Returns an array of fully-qualified table columns names "AS" their mapped entity field names.
Given a Select object and an array of column names, modifies the Select SELECT those columns AS their mapped entity field names FROM the mapped table.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The columns to select; if empty, selects all mapped columns.

docblock.description: Given an Insert query object and an entity object, modifies the Insert to use the mapped table, with the column names mapped from the entity field names, and binds the entity field values to the query.

Given an Update query object and an entity object, modifies the Update to use the mapped table, with the column names mapped from the entity field names, binding the entity field values to the query, and setting a where condition to match the primary column to the identity value.
docblock.long-description: When an array of initial data is present, the update will use only changed values (instead of sending all the entity values).

tag.name: param
tag.description: The initial data for the entity object; used to determine what values have changed on the entity.

docblock.description: Given a Delete query object and an entity object, modify the Delete to use the mapped table, and to set a where condition to match the primary column to the identity value.
Given an entity object, creates an array of mapped table column names to entity field values for inserts.
Given an entity object, creates an array of mapped table column names to entity field values for updates; when an array of initial data is present, the returned array will have only changed values.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The initial data for the entity.

docblock.description: Given an entity object and an array of initial data, returns an array mapped table columns and changed values.
Compares a new value and an old value to see if they are the same.
docblock.long-description: If they are both numeric, use loose (==) equality; otherwise, use strict (===) equality.

tag.name: return
tag.description: True if they are equal, false if not.

docblock.description: This file is part of the Aura Project for PHP.
Represents one column from a table.
The name of the column.
The datatype of the column.
The size of the column; typically, this is a number of bytes or characters for the column as a whole.
The scale of the column (i.e., the number of decimal places).
Is the column marked as `NOT NULL`?
The default value of the column.
Is the column auto-incremented?
Is the column part of the primary key?
Constructor.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The scale of the column (i.e., the number of digits after the decimal point).

tag.name: param
tag.description: Is the column defined as NOT NULL (i.e., required) ?

tag.name: param
tag.description: The default value of the column.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Is the column part of the primary key?

docblock.description: Returns property values.
Check if the property is defined with any value
Returns column object for var_export.
docblock.long-description: If you use "var_export" here, there is another issue here. Saying that we're exporting an instance of the class 'foo\bar\BazClass'. Here var_export will return something like: "foo\bar\BazClass::__set_state(...)". But we expect something like: "\foo\bar\BazClass::__set_state(...)". You can see it here: https://bugs.php.net/bug.php?id=52740.

Prepares and executes an SQL query, optionally binding values to named placeholders in the query text.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The text of the SQL query; or, a query object.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An associative array of data to bind to named placeholders in the query.

docblock.description: Begins a database transaction and turns off autocommit.
Commits the current database transaction and turns autocommit back on.
Rolls back the current database transaction and turns autocommit back on.
Creates a prepared PDOStatement and binds data values to placeholders.
docblock.long-description:
PDO itself is touchy about binding values. If you attempt to bind a value that does not have a corresponding placeholder, PDO will error. This method checks the query text to find placeholders and binds only data values that have placeholders in the text.

Similarly, PDO won't bind an array value. This method checks to see if the data to be bound is an array; if it is, the array is quoted and replaced into the text directly instead of binding it.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The text of the SQL query.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The values to bind (or quote) into the PDOStatement.

docblock.description: Fetches a sequential array of all rows from the database; the rows are represented as associative arrays.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The text of the SQL query; or, a query object.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An associative array of data to bind to the named placeholders.

docblock.description: Fetches an associative array of all rows from the database; the rows are represented as associative arrays.
docblock.long-description:
The array of all rows is keyed on the first column of each row.

N.b.: if multiple rows have the same first column value, the last row with that value will override earlier rows.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The text of the SQL statement, optionally with named placeholders.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An associative array of data to bind to the named placeholders.

docblock.description: Fetches the first column of all rows as a sequential array.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The text of the SQL query; or, a query object.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An associative array of data to bind to the named placeholders.

docblock.description: Fetches the very first value (i.e., first column of the first row).

tag.name: param
tag.description: The text of the SQL query; or, a query object.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An associative array of data to bind to the named placeholders.

docblock.description: Fetches an associative array of all rows as key-value pairs (first column is the key, second column is the value).

tag.name: param
tag.description: The text of the SQL query; or, a query object.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An associative array of data to bind to the named placeholders.

docblock.description: Fetches one row from the database as an associative array.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The text of the SQL query; or, a query object.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An associative array of data to bind to the named placeholders.

docblock.description: Safely quotes a value for an SQL statement.
docblock.long-description: If an array is passed as the value, the array values are quoted and then returned as a comma-separated string; this is useful for generating IN() lists.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An SQL-safe quoted value (or a string of separated-and-quoted values).

docblock.description: Quotes a value and places into a piece of text at a placeholder; the placeholder is a question-mark.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An SQL-safe quoted value (or string of separated values) placed into the original text.

docblock.description: Quote multiple text-and-value pieces.
docblock.long-description:
The placeholder is a question-mark; all placeholders will be replaced with the quoted value. For example ...

$list = [
     "WHERE date > ?"   => '2005-01-01',
     "  AND date < ?"   => '2005-02-01',
     "  AND type IN(?)" => ['a', 'b', 'c'],
];

$safe = $sql->quoteMulti($list);

// $safe = "WHERE date > '2005-01-02'
//          AND date < 2005-02-01
//          AND type IN('a','b','c')"

}}

tag.name: param
tag.description: A series of key-value pairs where the key is the placeholder text and the value is the value to be quoted into it. If the key is an integer, it is assumed that the value is piece of literal text to be used and not quoted.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Return the list pieces separated with this string (for example ' AND ').

tag.name: return
tag.description: An SQL-safe string composed of the list keys and quoted values.

docblock.description: Quotes a single identifier name (table, table alias, table column, index, sequence).
docblock.long-description:
If the name contains ' AS ', this method will separately quote the parts before and after the ' AS '.

If the name contains a space, this method will separately quote the parts before and after the space.

If the name contains a dot, this method will separately quote the parts before and after the dot.

docblock.description: Quotes all fully-qualified identifier names ("table.col") in a string, typically an SQL snippet for a SELECT clause.
docblock.long-description:
Does not quote identifier names that are string literals (i.e., inside single or double quotes).

Looks for a trailing ' AS alias' and quotes the alias as well.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The string in which to quote fully-qualified identifier names to quote.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The string with names quoted in it.

docblock.description: Inserts a row of data into a table.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An associative array where the key is the column name and the value is the value to insert for that column.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The number of rows affected, typically 1.

docblock.description: Updates a table with specified data based on WHERE conditions.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An associative array where the key is the column name and the value is the value to use for that column.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Additional data to bind to the query; these are not part of the update, and note that the $cols values will take precedence over these additional values.

docblock.description: Deletes rows from the table based on WHERE conditions.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Additional data to bind to the query.

docblock.description: Returns a new Select object.

docblock.description: Splits an identifier name into two parts, based on the location of the first dot.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The identifier name to be split.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An array of two elements; element 0 is the parts before the dot, and element 1 is the part after the dot. If there was no dot, element 0 will be null and element 1 will be the name as given.

docblock.description: Returns the last ID inserted on the connection for a given table and column sequence.
docblock.long-description: PostgreSQL uses a sequence named for the table and column to track auto-incremented IDs; you need to pass the table and column name to tell PostgreSQL which sequence to check.

Picks a connection in this order:

  • If there are no masters, the default connection.

Returns the SELECT parts composed as a string (does not include the union selects).
Sets the number of rows per page.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The number of rows to page at.

docblock.description: Gets the number of rows per page.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The number of rows per page.

docblock.description: Makes the select FOR UPDATE (or not).

tag.name: param
tag.description: Whether or not the SELECT is FOR UPDATE (default true).

docblock.description: Makes the select DISTINCT (or not).

tag.name: param
tag.description: Whether or not the SELECT is DISTINCT (default true).

docblock.description: Adds columns to the query.
docblock.long-description: Multiple calls to cols() will append to the list of columns, not overwrite the previous columns.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The column(s) to add to the query.

docblock.description: Adds a FROM table and columns to the query.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The table specification; "foo" or "foo AS bar".

docblock.description: Adds an aliased sub-select to the query.

tag.name: param
tag.description: If a Select object, use as the sub-select; if a string, the sub-select string.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The alias name for the sub-select.

docblock.description: Adds a JOIN table and columns to the query.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The join type: inner, left, natural, etc.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The table specification; "foo" or "foo AS bar".

docblock.description: Adds a JOIN to an aliased subselect and columns to the query.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The join type: inner, left, natural, etc.

tag.name: param
tag.description: If a Select object, use as the sub-select; if a string, the sub-select command string.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The alias name for the sub-select.

docblock.description: Adds grouping to the query.
Adds a HAVING condition to the query by AND; if a value is passed as the second param, it will be quoted and replaced into the condition wherever a question-mark appears.
docblock.long-description:
Array values are quoted and comma-separated.

{{code: php // simplest but non-secure $select->having("COUNT(id) = $count");

// secure
$select->having('COUNT(id) = ?', $count);

// equivalent security with named binding
$select->having('COUNT(id) = :count');
$select->bind('count', $count);

}}

docblock.description: Adds a HAVING condition to the query by AND; otherwise identical to `having()`.
Adds a row order to the query.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The columns and direction to order by.

docblock.description: Sets a limit count on the query.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The number of rows to return.

docblock.description: Sets a limit offset on the query.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Start returning after this many rows.

docblock.description: Sets the limit and count by page number.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Limit results to this page number.

docblock.description: Takes the current select properties and retains them, then sets UNION for the next set of properties.
Takes the current select properties and retains them, then sets UNION ALL for the next set of properties.
Clears the current select properties; generally used after adding a union.

A unit-of-work implementation.
A GatewayLocator for the gateways used to insert, update, and delete entity objects.
A collection of database connections extracted from the gateways.
A collection of all entity objects to be sent to the database.
A collection of all entity objects that were successfully inserted.
A collection of all entity objects that were successfully updated.
A collection of all entity objects that were successfully deleted.
The exception that occurred during exec(), causing a rollback.
The entity object that caused the exception.
Constructor.
Attached an entity object for insertion.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The gateway name in the locator.

docblock.description: Attached an entity object for updating.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The gateway name in the locator.

docblock.description: Attached an entity object for deletion.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The gateway name in the locator.

docblock.description: Attaches an entity to this unit of work.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Information about what to do with the entity.

docblock.description: Detaches an entity from this unit of work.
Loads all database connections from the gateways.
Gets the collection of database connections.
Executes the unit of work.

tag.name: return
tag.description: True if the unit succeeded, false if not.

docblock.description: Begins a transaction on all connections.
Inserts an entity via a gateway.
Updates an entity via a gateway.
Deletes an entity via a gateway.
Commits the transactions on all connections.
Rolls back the transactions on all connections.
Gets all the attached entities.
Gets all the inserted entities.
Gets all the updated entities.
Gets all the deleted entities.
Gets the exception that caused a rollback in exec().
Gets the entity that caused the exception in exec().
